title: Understanding $$t-tests$$
text: A $$t-test$$ is a statistical test used to compare the means of two groups. It helps determine if the differences between the groups are statistically significant.

title: When to use a $$t-test$$
text: Consider using a $$t-test$$ when you have two groups and you want to know if their means are different from each other.

title: Types of $$t-tests$$
text: There are different types of $$t-tests$$, such as independent $$t-tests$$ and paired $$t-tests$$. Each is used in different scenarios depending on the data structure.

hintAnswer: To determine if there is a significant difference between the means of two groups.
title: Identifying the correct answer
text: Which of the following is the primary purpose of a $$t-test$$ in statistics?
choices: To determine the correlation between variables.
>To determine if there is a significant difference between the means of two groups.
>To calculate the median of a dataset.
